page.title: 05Countryside Concern-Twyford
page.content: Changing practices in farming are not only improving crops and livestock but they are causing concern to many people as follows: 1.Increased land drainage e.g.plastic pipes laid 3 feet deep in a bed of gravel cause rapid runn off into rivers thus increasing flooding in low lying areas e.g. water meadows.It also is said to add to river pollution.as chemical sprays and fertilisers wash into the river before they can be neutralised in the soil. 2.Use of chemical sprays effecting wild life and possibly food crops. 3.Use of hormones in poultry and cattle causing concern as to the possible effects which people may suffer when eating animals which have been so treated.
